content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the start and end points of the problem are swapped, the new shortest path should be the reverse of the original shortest path.)

The shortest path from node 2 to node 8 is:

1->2->4->8

Remember that the shortest path is affected by the order in which you visit the nodes. If you reverse the nodes in the graph and the start and destination nodes, the shortest path will also be reversed. In this case, the shortest path from node 8 to node 2 would be:

8->4->2

Therefore, the shortest path in both cases is:

1->2->4->8 (in the original graph) or 8->4->2 (in the reversed graph).

The shortest path from node 8 to node 2 is:

8->4->2

This path is the shortest way to reach node 2 from node 8 by following the links in the graph. If you want to know about any other shortest path or any other information, please provide more details.
